channel.title: BBC News - World
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Afghanistan crisis: Taliban kill civilians in resistance stronghold
item.description: The militants target civilians in Panjshir, the BBC finds, despite promises of restraint.

item.title: World now sees twice as many days over 50C
item.description: BBC research finds the number of days passing 50C has doubled in the past 40 years.

item.title: Afghanistan: More than $1bn pledged for Afghanistan
item.description: Countries vow to step up support as people in Afghanistan face "perhaps their most perilous hour".

item.title: North Korea tests new long-range cruise missile
item.description: It suggests the country is developing new weapons despite food shortages and an economic crisis.

item.title: Nigeria jailbreak in Kabba: Prisoners on the run after armed raid
item.description: About 240 inmates were freed after armed attackers stormed the facility in Kogi state on Sunday.

item.title: French slave statue defaced in apparent racist attack
item.description: A statue of Modeste Testas, an African slave, has been vandalised with white paint in Bordeaux.

item.title: Fake Walmart news release claimed it would accept cryptocurrency
item.description: A news story claiming Walmart would accept cryptocurrency Litecoin was fabricated, the retail giant says.

item.title: Afghan women hit back at Taliban with #DoNotTouchMyClothes campaign
item.description: Afghan women show off their traditional dress as black burqas spread under the Taliban.

item.title: Man arrested with bayonet and machete near US Capitol
item.description: Police say the man claimed to be "on patrol" and talked about white supremacy when he was arrested.

item.title: Megapod of feeding humpback whales 'so special'
item.description: A megapod of over 100 humpback whales has been filmed feeding off Australia's New South Wales coast.

item.title: Britney Spears announces engagement to Sam Asghari
item.description: The singer, who is fighting a legal battle over her conservatorship, met fiancé Sam Asghari in 2016.

item.title: Eitan Biran: Italy investigates 'kidnap' of cable car crash survivor
item.description: The grandfather accused of whisking his grandson to Israel is placed under investigation in Italy.

item.title: Russia election: Opposition crushed ahead of managed polls
item.description: Exiled or disqualified, opposition voices warn of a government stitch-up in this week’s elections.

item.title: German election: Hunger strikers want greater action on climate change
item.description: Six young people say they won't end their hunger strike until the leading candidates meet them.

item.title: Why North Korea keeps launching missiles
item.description: North Korea keeps testing missiles despite international condemnation. Why does Pyongyang persist?

item.title: Pope’s Slovakia visit sends signal after brief Hungary stop
item.description: The first papal visit in 18 years produces pleasure and puzzlement after a brief stop in Hungary.

item.title: Kenyan influencers paid to take 'guerrilla warfare’ online
item.description: Shadowy financiers are closing down a once democratic space on Twitter for political debate in Kenya.

item.title: India appointed three top women judges. Is it too early to celebrate?
item.description: Appointment of three women to India's Supreme Court is being hailed as a "historic moment".

item.title: The pressures - and rewards - of being an influencer
item.description: Running your own popular YouTube channel can be lucrative, but it comes with downsides.

item.title: Life at 50C: The toxic gas flares fuelling Nigeria's climate change
item.description: Joy and her family are among 2m Nigerians living within 4km of a gas flare in Nigeria's oil-rich south.

item.title: What's gone wrong with the 'War on Terror' in Africa?
item.description: Twenty years after the US 'War on Terror' began, Islamist movements have spread across Africa.

item.title: China's coronavirus-fuelled surfing boom
item.description: Covid travel restrictions that have limited foreign travel have led to a boom in surfing in China.

item.title: 'My dad was killed in first hate-crime after 9/11'
item.description: The story of the first American to be killed in the backlash - a turbaned Sikh man in Arizona.

item.title: ICYMI: A big week for small things
item.description: Here's a round-up of some the week's news you might have missed.
